#maths3to8 @nccaIE Children @StPetersBray used @KhanAcademy for self/peer teaching & differentiation. Set-up time paid off! @MATHletes_IE
#maths3to8 @nccaIE Excitement of teaching/learning -and peer learning- shared by Martina Sexton @StPetersBray  @MATHletes_IE @khanacademy
#maths3to8 @nccaIE Children's engagement and lifelong learning - big plus for @MATHletes_IE @khanacademy @StPetersBray
#maths3to8 @nccaIE Children @StPetersBray 'went to library, etc to access KhanAcademy outside school. Kudos Martina Sexton! @MATHletes_ie
#maths3to8 @nccaIE Children @StPetersBray 'wanted to be pushed', Martina Sexton. Inspiring maths learning with @MATHletes_IE @khanacademy
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Play is a lifelong disposition. It belongs in all our lives. We need the skills play affords to be lifelong learners'.
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Need to ask critical questions about tolerance when children need more time to develop important skills'. Yes.
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Go away and practice your numbers until they are the right way round.' Ouch. Big de-motivator for young children :-(
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Continuous flow between truth and myth in children's play-talk on complex issues'. Yes - great questions from children.
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'What does it mean to build a curriculum from children's interests? Teacher leads and directs.' Liz Wood
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Children's interests are profound and existential eg children working through life and death in play' Wow. Liz Wood
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Need to build on children's 'funds-of-knowledge', interests, as stimulus for inquiry and knowledge building' Liz Wood
@mjlynch6 @NCCAie Agreed. Range of learning opportunities needed.
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Play progresses along pathways of increasing complexity: themes, social relationships, themes' says Prof Liz Wood.
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Math is cognitively fundamental if done right. It's a set of processes not worksheets.' Clements
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Children have to dig down to their metacognitive and metalinguistic depth to engage with maths problems.' Clements
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Doing maths doesn't mean giving up play. False dichotomy. Experience becomes mathematical when we talk about it.' Yah!
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Board games - great for mental arithmetic. Opportunity to think about and reflect on number actions' Clements
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Small groups of children working together -under-used pedagogical resource'. Great video little girl advising her buddy!

#maths3to8 @nccaIE 
'We don't want kids to empty their minds to learn the rules, we want them to fill their minds with math ideas' Clements
#maths3to8 @nccaIE Curriculum, assessment, teaching based on research-based learning trajectories: 1 Goals 2 Pathway 3 Instructional Tasks.
#maths3to8 @nccaIE 'Horrendous renaming!' Encourage children to use different algorithms for subtraction - Doug Clements.
#maths3to8 @nccaIE Doug Clements videos - powerful window into children's maths thinking. Very frustrated little girl who 'doesn't get it!'
#maths3to8 @nccaIE Doug Clements talks about value of playing with triangles and squares - shapes in shapes - EY Geometry!
